page.title: 05ST.ERNEY PARISH
page.content: Most of this land is farmed by "owner-occupiers", although there is a growing danger of smaller farms being sold up and made into bigger agricultural holdings. There are already two cases of this in St. Erney.The nearest amenities are at Landrake a little more than a mile away from St. Erney and so all 43 inhabitants have a car and a phone. There is no bus service. The oldest house in St. Erney is Markwell. A farm of particular interest is known as{POLDRISSIK FARM.}It covers 160 acres and each field is about 7 acres. The farmer keeps sheep and beef cattle which he sells as yearlings. In an old barn here there is a mural which is earlier than the 14th century. It is thought that the building was a chapel used by the monks.
